title: Foundations: Linux Journey
description: Learn the ways of Linux-fu, for free.

courses.title: Getting Started
courses.description: What is Linux? Get started with choosing a distribution and installation.

courses.title: Command Line
courses.description: Learn the fundamentals of the command line, navigating files, directories and more.

courses.title: Text-Fu
courses.description: Learn basic text manipulation and navigation.

courses.title: Advanced Text-Fu
courses.description: Navigate text like a Linux spider monkey with vim and emacs.

courses.title: User Management
courses.description: Learn about user roles and management.

courses.title: File Permissions
courses.description: Learn about permission levels and modifying permissions.

courses.title: Monitor Processes
courses.description: Learn about the running processes on the system and how to monitor them.

courses.title: Software Distribution and Packages
courses.description: Learn all about the dpkg, apt-get, rpm and yum package management tools.

courses.title: Devices
courses.description: Learn about Linux devices and how they interact with the kernel and user space.

courses.title: Filesystems and the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard
courses.description: Learn about the different types of filesystems, the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard, disk partitioning, and more.

courses.title: System Boot Process
courses.description: Learn about the stages of the Linux boot process and how the hardware startup systems work.

courses.title: The Linux Kernel
courses.description: The most foundational part of a GNU/Linux system is the Linux kernel itself. Learn about how it works and how to configure it.

courses.title: Init Systems
courses.description: Learn about the different Linux init systems: SysV, Upstart, and systemd.
